Class Validate

  • java.lang.Object
    • Validate

  • class Validate
extends java.lang.Object
    Validate - The class processes user input, depending on the situation, through different methods to validate it to an appropriately sized integer.
    Version:
    2018.1
    Author:
    Kalle Lindevall

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Validate() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static int numBoard(int numToCheck)
      This loop checks the user input for the size of the gameboard.
      static int numMark(int numToCheck, int numWidth, int numHeight)
      This loop checks the user input for the marks required to win the game.
      static int numPlay(int numToCheck, int compareBoard)
      This loop checks the user input values for the coordinates for the human player's mark.

    • Constructor Detail

        Validate()

    • Method Detail

      • numBoard

        public static int numBoard(int numToCheck)
        This loop checks the user input for the size of the gameboard.
        Parameters:
        numToCheck - either the value for the height or the width of the gameboard
        Returns:
        an integer equal to or bigger than 3, for either gameboardHeight or gameboardWidth

      • numMark

        public static int numMark(int numToCheck,
                          int numWidth,
                          int numHeight)
        This loop checks the user input for the marks required to win the game.
        Parameters:
        numToCheck - the user input value for the marks required to win
        numWidth - value of the width of the gameboard, that is compared to the value of the height
        numHeight - value of the height of the gameboard, that is compared to the value of the width
        Returns:
        an integer that is 3 or bigger and equal or smaller than the shorter side of the gameboard

      • numPlay

        public static int numPlay(int numToCheck,
                          int compareBoard)
        This loop checks the user input values for the coordinates for the human player's mark.
        Parameters:
        numToCheck - the user input value for either the column or the row coordinate for their mark
        compareBoard - value of the width/height of the gameboard, that is compared to the column/row coordinate input by the user
        Returns:
        an integer that is 3 or bigger and equal or smaller than the shorter side of the gameboard
